awd_titl_txt: IRNC: Backbone: NEAAR: Networks for European, American, and African Research
awd_abstract_narration:
The Networks for European, American, and African Research (NEAAR) collaboration is a powerful, cross organizational project that will provide services and bandwidth connecting researchers in the US with their counterparts in Europe and Africa. This project will have an immediate impact on the research environment and also supports future application and technology advances. 

Indiana University (IU) jointly leads the NEAAR collaboration with GÉANT, the European research and education network (REN), in a cooperative partnership with the African regional RENs: the UbuntuNet Alliance, the Arab States Research and Education Network (ASREN), the West and Central African Research and Education Network (WACREN), as well as the South African National Research Network (SANReN) and the Tertiary Education and Research Network of South Africa (TENET). IU also coordinates domestically with Internet2 and the Energy Sciences Network (ESnet). Through its extensive regional partnerships, NEAAR has the potential to reach research and education (R&E) communities in over 80 countries across three continents.

NEAAR has the potential to be transformational to NSF-funded science by providing not only the network but also the human expertise to make the most of international collaborations and data sharing, thereby increasing research and educational opportunities. Through additional capacity to Europe and targeted support of data and networking support services in Africa, NEAAR will be able to support the majority of the NSF-funded research sharing between Africa and the US. IU has identified over 60 preliminary groups to work directly with to increase their data capacity and ability to collaborate. Advanced data sharing fundamentally changes and extends the research that is feasible between partners, and NEAAR has the potential to have an unprecedented impact on US-Africa collaboration.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering

por.por_cntn:
The Networks for European, American, and African Research (NEAAR) collaboration provided a powerful, cross organizational resource to provide services and bandwidth connecting researchers in the US with their counterparts in Europe, and Africa. Indiana University (IU) jointly led this project with co-leads from G?ANT, the European Research and Education Network (REN), and the UbuntuNet Alliance, the regional REN for eastern Africa. Additional African partnerships included Arab States Research and Education Network (ASREN), West and Central African Research and Education Network (WACREN), and South African National Research Network (SANReN). 

The NEAAR project supported network circuits and services between the US and Europe, in addition to science engagement activities to support US collaborations with researchers in Europe and Africa from September 1, 2016 through January 31, 2022. NEAAR was part of the Advanced North Atlantic networking consortium, and transferred science and research data between US researchers and collaborators in 158 of the 195 countries in the world. 

The project also supported measurement and monitoring, training, and science engagement. NEAAR was one of the first adopters of the NetSage measurement and monitoring infrastructure (http://nea3r.netsage.global), and used this monitoring tool extensively throughout the project for reporting and project support. Nine perfSONAR training sessions were held with African regional and national REN partners, which in turn supported the NEAAR perfSONAR mesh testing infrastructure. Over six years, we worked with over sixty partners on various aspects for science engagement and to improve the performance and routing of international data transfers, including a focus on COVID data sources at the beginning of the COVID-19 pandemic.


 

 


Last Modified: 06/01/2022
Modified by: Jennifer M Schopf

Images (1 of )
